isis.stitle: TSI 93-16-05 - Shrader Valves and Standard SAE Metric Charging Ports on Air Conditioning Systems Charged With HFC-134a

subjectgroup.subject: Shrader Valves and Standard SAE Metric Charging Ports on Air Conditioning Systems Charged With HFC-134a

geninfo.para: This TSI applies to all models with air conditioning charged with HFC-134a.

The shrader valve ports located near the compressor on the high pressure side of air conditioning systems charged with HFC-134a ( Figure 1) are for switch installation, NOT FOR CHARGING OR DISCHARGING THE AIR CONDITIONING SYSTEM. International has continued to use shrader fittings for installation of switches on air conditioning compressor to allow the use of the same switches for air conditioning systems charged with HFC-134a and R-12. This was done to help standardize air conditioning components and keep from having additional part numbers.

figure.caption: Figure 1. Typical Fan Drive and/or Radiator Shutter Override Switch Installation on Vehicles Built with HFC-134a

calloutgroup.callout1: 1. FAN DRIVE OR SHUTTER OVERRIDE SWITCH
2. SAE-METRIC QUICK DISCONNECT SERVICE PORTS ON THE COMPRESSOR

geninfo.para: The service ports on air conditioning systems charged with HFC-134a are STANDARD SAE METRIC QUICK DISCONNECT fittings located on the compressor ( Figure 1), on the receiver/dryer, under the right side of the dash panel on 2000, 4000 and 8000 models and under the right side cab floor on 5000 and 9000 Series vehicles. These are the only fittings that are to be used to charge or discharge the air conditioning system.

The manifold gauge set hose ends are different for each type of refrigerant ( Figure 2). The hose ends on manifold gauge hoses for R-12 have internal threads to fit shrader fittings ( Figure 2). They will not work on HFC-134a charged systems because the manifold gauge hose ends have metric quick disconnect fittings, along with a valve ( Figure 2), that will work only on systems charged with HFC-134a.

Also, it is important that R-12 and HFC-134a refrigerants not be mixed when discharging to a recycling station or charging either type system. Each type of refrigerant must have its own dedicated recycling and charging station. That is one of the reasons for the different types of hose fittings on manifold gauge sets for the two refrigerants.

note.para: If there is a shrader fitting on the compressor of an HFC-134a charged air conditioning system that is not being used and is capped off, it is not suitable for servicing the system because it is on the high pressure side. There is no low pressure side shrader valve to use to set up a manifold gauge set.

geninfo.para: It is very important that service personnel who service air conditioning systems on International vehicles become familiar with the latest service manual sections pertaining to air conditioning. The latest version of these sections include information on servicing HFC-134a. They are:

item.para: CTS-5062J - Air Conditioning Basic Theory and Service
CTS-5068J - Air Conditioning - Compressor and Clutch (2cyl)

geninfo.para: TSI-92-16-07, circulated in October 1992, contains information related to the differences between air conditioning systems that use R-12 and HFC-134a refrigerant. Precautions and changes in service procedures and tools are also covered.
